PIC32CX-BZ Zigbee API Reference
Data Fields
_ZclRequestTunnelResponsePayload_t Struct Reference

#include <zclSmartEnergyTunnelCluster.h>

Data Fields

uint16_t tunnelId
uint8_t status
uint16_t maximumIncomingTransferSize

Detailed Description

RequestTunnelResponse is sent by the server in response to a RequestTunnel command previously received from the client. See ZSE Profile Spec. r17, Figure D.45.

Definition at line 675 of file zclSmartEnergyTunnelCluster.h.

Field Documentation

uint16_t _ZclRequestTunnelResponsePayload_t::tunnelId

A number between 0..65535 that uniquely identifies the tunnel. This ID must now be used to send data through this tunnel (TunnelID, TransferData) and is also required to close the tunnel again (CloseTunnel). If the command has failed, the TunnelStatus contains the reason of the error and the TunnelID is set to 0xFFFF.

Definition at line 681 of file zclSmartEnergyTunnelCluster.h.

uint8_t _ZclRequestTunnelResponsePayload_t::status

The TunnelStatus parameter indicates the server’s internal status after the execution of a RequestTunnel command.

See also:
ZCL_SeTunnelStatus_t.

Definition at line 684 of file zclSmartEnergyTunnelCluster.h.

uint16_t _ZclRequestTunnelResponsePayload_t::maximumIncomingTransferSize

A value that defines the size, in octets, of the maximum data packet that can be transferred to the server in the payload of a single TransferData command.

Definition at line 687 of file zclSmartEnergyTunnelCluster.h.
